1610754180_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
> [reichama](#comment_66_19M1Unu2z3j9WyiQ1vcgG6yGnPRmTkUkVe): Just use Nextcloud Talk and don't trust stuff you don't host yourself. If only all these applications could talk to each other, then I wouldn't have to have half a dozen of them installed 
I do this with matrix

> [qzm](#comment_12_1HyrFrFXUHZC58qLuFrjAXm2Jjkb3Y6ufX): Could you talk a little bit about your set up? What are you using as a client? I know the riot app doesn’t exist anymore, What are you using for mobile?

Sure! I use Element which I think maybe used to be riot but it works all the same. I stood up the server on my own domain and everything pretty much worked. I can reach chats and people on other servers just fine and run a private E2E chat with me and some friends that lives on my server. Of course the data being on the server is not ideal but I own the server and it is encrypted. This is the best privacy/usability compromise I have found. I was even able to get normy friends to put element on their phones and once the got matrix.org ids it is all pretty intuitive for them. I just make sure to stress that this is a step in the right direction not a silver bullet. 

I am also on mastodon but I haven't stood up a server yet.

> [qzm](#comment_12_1HyrFrFXUHZC58qLuFrjAXm2Jjkb3Y6ufX): Could you talk a little bit about your set up? What are you using as a client? I know the riot app doesn’t exist anymore, What are you using for mobile?

Sorry I am at work and was kinda distracted. The short answer is element on phone and the website. It also helps with normies to tell them it is like discord and not IRC lol

One other thing I have been looking at lately is keybase.  Anyone used it before?

https://book.keybase.io/wallet

1599651874_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
> [nekololi](#comment_486_1FzZsDQdh8wk71bDLxURPzmAt2FXehoNAB): that isn't why it's doomed to fail. it's doomed to fail because there is no federated network, there are instead 2 or 3 different mini-federations that refuse to federate with each other, resulting in a most ridiculous clusterfuck of a social ecosystem. i used to think federation was a good thing, but people cannot handle it in this modern social/political climate, so the only true way forward will be fully distributed peer-to-peer networks.

Not perfect for sure but honestly is is still better that FB or twitter.
